location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Map Showing Anglo-Turkish Boundaries in the Arabian Peninsula

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paper.Dimensions 303 x 174mm, on sheet 334 x 200mm.

mods.abstract: This map depicts two Anglo-Turkish boundaries in the Arabian Peninsula. The northernmost line represents the 'blue line', which was laid down in the non-ratified Anglo-Ottoman Convention of 1913 and redefined and adopted in the Anglo-Ottoman convention of the following year. The line that descends south-west from the blue line is the 'violet line', which was laid down in the Anglo-Ottoman convention of 1914.
